description: Example LV study demonstrating powerUnit usage - 150 kVA @ 240V with 100 MVA utility source

components.name: Utility Source
components.notes: 100 MVA short circuit MVA at 13.2 kV

components.name: 150 kVA Distribution Transformer
components.notes: 150 kVA transformer - powerUnit explicitly set to kVA. Without explicit unit, system would default to kVA based on 240V secondary (≤1kV)

expectedResults.notes: Expected fault current ~8-10 kA at end of 30m service cable. With powerUnit=kVA, transformer impedance is correctly ~0.0154 Ω. If mistakenly treated as 150 MVA, Z would be 1000x smaller and ISC would be ~8500 kA (implausible).

migrationNotes.powerUnit_usage: This example demonstrates proper powerUnit usage for LV transformers
migrationNotes.without_powerUnit: If powerUnit field is omitted, system defaults to 'kVA' for secondaryV ≤ 1kV
migrationNotes.warning: Without powerUnit field, a console warning will be logged indicating the assumed unit
migrationNotes.migration_path: Add 'powerUnit': 'kVA' or 'MVA' to all transformer definitions to eliminate ambiguity
